name: mine construction, gold-silver-zinc-lead-copper | mine infrastructure, gold-silver-zinc-lead-copper | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1309/documentation

This dataset describes the production of 1 unit of gold-silver-zinc-lead-copper mine infrastructure. It includes land use and buildings and machinery consumption, as in open pit mining. Data corresponds to Swedish mines Aitik, Boliden and Garpenberg, which produce gold, silver and other metals.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From unoccupied land foreseen for a gold-silver-zinc-lead-copper mine.

This activity ends with the transformation of occupied land, in time.

The dataset includes land transformation and occupation during the different stages of the mine, as well as the consumption of buildings and machinery for open pit mining.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Land use for Sweden, other inputs based on rough assumptions.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The mine is foreseen to have a lifetime of 50 years.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Buildings and machinery are based on global assumptions. The figures were extrapolated on the basis of the ore production (2.32E10 kg per year)

exchanges.description:
Calculated value: The entire area of the mine is not in active use at one time; "disturbed area in active use" value reported in literature is assumed to be the average share of the mine area in use along 50 years of operation.

The occupation of the mine was then calculated as:

Ocupation, mineral extraction site = (Total disturbed area in active use) * 50 years = 4.65E07 m2 * 50 years = 2.325E08 m2y
Estimation: "Transformation, from unspecified" stands for the area disturbed during lifetime of mine.
Estimation: "Transformation, to heterogeneous, agricultural" stands for the area that is revegetated.

Estimation: As of this exchange, mine construction process represents that of open pit mining, and is assumed to be equivalent o the one depicted in the ecoinvent generic dataset (v2) "non-ferrous metal, mine, surface", in Part XIV of cited source.
